post.title: New Year, New Job
post.content:
The past year was bittersweet, I grew professionally and personally, experienced great joys and deep pains, sometimes simultaneously.I attended a bunch of great conferences (Forward 2, Press Publish, Open Source Bridge, AlterConf CascadiaFest,Open Source & Feelings ) met a ton of awesome people, I started a meetup group, met more awesome people, I gave my first technical talk atSeattle JS in front of supportive awesome people and I quit my job without a another job lined up.

I had originally written a post about my decision to look for a new job, but aftera nights sleep on it I decided to redact it. I'd rather just say thatI am super excited to start my new job at Linden Lab.I'm equally excited to say that the product I will be supporting is one that I have been envisioning since I was doing 3D development in college, Virtual Reality worlds, finally! In their own words,"Project Sansar is the codename of our new platform for user-created virtual experiences. Sansar will democratize VR as a creative medium and make it easy for people to create, share, and profit from social virtual experiences."I couldn't be more invigorated and ready to start 2016, I have more drive and motivation now than ever as I look forward to coding, blogging, meetups and conferencing, I hope to see you around, IRL or online.
